001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import java.io.File;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.nio.file.Files;
006import java.nio.file.Path;
007import java.nio.file.Paths;
008import java.nio.file.StandardCopyOption;
009import java.util.Comparator;
010import java.util.List;
011import java.util.stream.Stream;
012
013/**
014 * Utility-class that invokes standard JDK utilities, but wraps {@link java.io.IOException}
015 * into {@link IllegalStateException} and creates missing parent directories.
016 */
017public class CoreFileUtils {
018
019    /**
020     * The same as {@link #loadFileContent(File)}, but accept the path to that file as {@link String}
021     *
022     * @param pathToLoadStr the path of file to laod as {@link String}
023     * @return the content of that file as {@link String} or {@code null} if it's impossible to do
024     */
025    public static String loadFileContent(String pathToLoadStr) {
026        return loadFileContent(Paths.get(pathToLoadStr).toFile());
027    }
028
029    /**
030     * Loading the content of {@code file} as {@link String} (it's better to use for text-files only)
031     * and returning {@code null} if the content of file could not be loaded for any reason.
032     *
033     * @param fileToLoad file to read the content
034     * @return the content of {@code file} as {@link String} or {@code null} if it's impossible to do
035     */
036    public static String loadFileContent(File fileToLoad) {
037        if (fileToLoad == null || !fileToLoad.isFile()) {
038            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
039                "could not load the file %s because it does not exist or it's not a normal file",
040                fileToLoad == null ? "<< NULL >>" : "'" + fileToLoad + "'"));
041        }
042        try {
043            return Files.readString(fileToLoad.toPath());
044        } catch (IOException ignored) {
045            return null;
046        }
047    }
048
049    /**
050     * Loading the content of {@code file} as list of lines,
051     * where each line is an element of returning {@link List} of {@link String}.
052     *
053     * @param filePathToLoad path of file to read the content as lines
054     * @return the content of {@code filePathToLoad} as {@link List List&lt;String&gt;}
055     */
056    public static List<String> loadFileLines(Path filePathToLoad) {
057        if (filePathToLoad == null) {
058            throw new IllegalStateException(
059                "the path to file to load lines MUST NOT be null");
060        }
061        try (Stream<String> lines = Files.lines(filePathToLoad)) {
062            return lines.toList();
063        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
064            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
065                "could not load the file '%s' as list of lines", filePathToLoad), ioEx);
066        }
067    }
068
069    /**
070     * Saving the content into the file {@code fileToSave} (if the file is not empty - it will be truncated).
071     * All missing parent directories will be created if necessary.
072     *
073     * @param fileToSave the file to save into
074     * @param fileContent the content to be saved
075     * @throws IllegalStateException in case of something goes wrong (which must not really happen)
076     */
077    public static void saveFileContent(File fileToSave, String fileContent) {
078        if (fileToSave == null) {
079            throw new IllegalStateException(
080                "could not save the file content, because fileToSave is null");
081        }
082        try {
083            if (fileToSave.getParentFile() != null) {
084                Files.createDirectories(fileToSave.getParentFile().toPath());
085            }
086            Files.writeString(fileToSave.toPath(), fileContent);
087        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
088            throw new IllegalStateException("could not save the content into the file " + fileToSave, ioEx);
089        }
090    }
091
092    /**
093     * Copy the file {@code sourceFile} to the file {@code targetFile}
094     * and creates all missing parent directories if necessary.
095     */
096    public static void copyFile(File sourceFile, File targetFile) {
097        if (sourceFile == null || !sourceFile.isFile()) {
098            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
099                "could not copy the file %s because it's not a normal file",
100                sourceFile == null ? "<< NULL >>" : "'" + sourceFile + "'"));
101        }
102        if (targetFile == null) {
103            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
104                "could not copy the file '%s' because target file is null", sourceFile));
105        }
106        try {
107            if (targetFile.getParentFile() != null) {
108                Files.createDirectories(targetFile.getParentFile().toPath());
109            }
110            Files.copy(sourceFile.toPath(), targetFile.toPath(), StandardCopyOption.REPLACE_EXISTING);
111        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
112            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
113                "could not copy the file '%s' into '%s' because of IOException",
114                sourceFile, targetFile), ioEx);
115        }
116    }
117
118    /**
119     * The same as {@link Files#deleteIfExists(Path)}, but ignore any kind of {@link IOException}.
120     * <hr/>
121     * <u><i>Note:</i></u> For non-empty directory the method {@link #removeSilent(File)} should be used,
122     * because this method will always return {@code false} for non-empty directory and remove nothing.
123     *
124     * @param pathToRemove the path to either a file or an empty directory to remove
125     * @return {@code true} if the item (file or empty directory) is removed, or {@code false} otherwise
126     */
127    public static boolean removePathSilent(Path pathToRemove) {
128        if (pathToRemove == null) {
129            return false;
130        }
131        try {
132            return Files.deleteIfExists(pathToRemove);
133        } catch (IOException ignored) {
134            return false;
135        }
136    }
137
138    /**
139     * Recursively removes either a single file or the whole directory and returns the number of removed items
140     *
141     * @param fileOrDirToRemove path to either a file or a directory to remove recursively
142     * @return the number of removed items
143     */
144    public static int removeSilent(File fileOrDirToRemove) {
145        if (fileOrDirToRemove == null) {
146            return -1;
147        }
148        if (!fileOrDirToRemove.exists()) {
149            return 0;
150        }
151        try {
152            if (fileOrDirToRemove.isFile()) {
153                return fileOrDirToRemove.delete() ? 1 : 0;
154            }
155            try (Stream<Path> walkPathStream = Files.walk(fileOrDirToRemove.toPath())) {
156                return (int) walkPathStream.sorted(Comparator.reverseOrder()) // Sort in reverse order to delete contents before directories
157                    .filter(CoreFileUtils::removePathSilent)
158                    .count();
159            }
160        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
161            return -2;
162        }
163    }
164}
